content.description:
After the first three bolts shared with Retaliation, bust left onto the face. There's an unexpected path to reach the final bolt in the middle of a blank wall. The final run to the anchor is a direct traverse to the three bolt anchor. Clip the left two bolts for an equalized anchor.

There is a bail biner on the final bolt to facilitate cleaning your draws.
content.location: Same start as Retaliation heads left to the three bolt anchor.

content.description: Steeep, 45 degree overhanging arete with jugs and crimps. It's a lot of overhang! Make sure to have an attentive belay as a lazy belay could land you on the slab behind you.
content.location: Starts just left of the middle cave and heads rightward.

content.description: Short route up on the right side of the wall. It's a bit odd... I suppose it makes a some form of a warmup for the harder routes on the wall.
content.location: Scramble up the 5.0 slab to reach. The first bolt is mostly useful for the belayer.

content.description: Jug pockets lead to big moves on barely incut edges. Lots of deceiving holds. This one is a very tough onsight as you'll build quite a pump searching all of the false holds!
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with lower off biners
content.location: Second bolted route to the left. Shares start with Isis 5.12c and shares anchors with Fur Pie 5.9

content.description: This is the easiest bolted line at the Caverns. It was originally listed as 5.9, but most have voted solid 5.10. It's got some real tricky bits! Few bits of loose rock.
